alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 11 at 3:42AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 AM EST, The stream gauge along Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek reported a level of 12.65 and rising. This is above action stage of 12 feet. The river is likely out of its banks and may be causing flooding of Back Creek due to back water effects. - Areas along Back Creek south of Harrisburg are the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Pharr Mill Road, Robinson Church Road, and Stallings Road may begin to flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant and Midland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
